JobFullDesc: Are you interested in working in a dynamic environment that offers opportunities for professional growth and new responsibilities? Are you interested in helping clients drive alignment with their business, improve organizational and human resource performance and establish a culture focused on adding business value? If you are seeking a role that offers you the opportunity to advise Government and Public Services (GPS) clients through critical and complex issues, while allowing you to develop personally and professionally, consider a career in Deloitte's Human Capital practice. Work you'll doResponsible for supporting the development of a knowledge management repository of training materials on SharePoint, developing training materials, and delivering end-user training for the suite of applications, including Oracle EBS, Oracle OBIEE reporting solution, and a custom user interface. Strong written and verbal communication skills, attention to detail, and organization are highly desired. Prior experience developing and delivering training, using PowerPoint, and using SharePoint as a document repository is highly desired.The team The Workforce Transformation practice delivers solutions to help our clients transform their workforces and workplaces for business success in this era of technology disruption. We deliver solutions to enable our clients' success in creating the very best workforce to achieve their business aspirations - providing end-to-end workforce lifecycle solutions. Workforce Transformation supports our clients by:Imagining and transforming the composition and capabilities of the workforce to match the needs of the future of work in this age of technology disruption  Delivering end-to-end transformations of workforce programs, services and processes to identify, build and incent to drive success of organizations and their workforces  Delivering solutions within each workforce domain: Branding & Acquisition; Rewards & Well-being; Performance, Learning & Career Mobility; Leadership & Teaming; Diversity & Inclusion  Qualifications  Required:Bachelor's Degree in business, human resources, communications, industrial and organizational development/psychology or a related discipline 2 years of relevant consulting or industry experience  Business Writing, Communication Skills Training Facilitation and Logistics Training Content and Delivery PowerPoint skills Training facilitation experience Proven experience effectively prioritizing workload to meet deadlines and work objectives Demonstrated ability to write clearly, succinctly, and in a manner that appeals to a wide audience Proficiency in word processing, spreadsheet, and presentation creation tools, as well as Internet research tools Ability to learn new technology and translate technical information into easy-to-understand communications and training Experience in training development Experience developing communications materials (fact sheets, newsletters, briefing decks, etc.) Understanding of training development and system design lifecycle and phases Some travel may be required (While travel may be required for the role, due to COVID-19, non-essential travel has been suspended until further notice.) Must be able to obtain and maintain required clearance for this role  Preferred:Prior professional services or federal consulting experience Advanced degree in a related discipline Oracle EBS, OBIEE, SharePoint management
